title: Part A and B
stimulusHtml:
The primary goals of this question are to assess a studentâ€™s ability to (1) compute z-scores and (2) compare an observed value using two distributions and determine which distribution is the more likely source of the observation.

Scoring

Parts (a) and (b) are each scored as essentially correct (E), partially correct (P), or incorrect (I).
descriptions: One part partially correct and one part incorrect

One part essentially correct and one part incorrect

OR

two parts partially correct
One part essentially correct and one part partially correct
